instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message: Problem with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not charging, customer used china replica charger, changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and isl, now when put original charger to board takes 1-15 sec to get green light. and after green/orange pulls ppbus 12v to 3.7v and no boot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages when voltage drop; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Check resistamce between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Test if works with lab PSU, or fake charger.

<DIODE>D7010</DIODE> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> are the first suspects.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message: if i remove <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, and try charger the green/orange light after <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> removed green/orange light present
1- 15.48, 2- 16.63, 3- 4, 9- 137mv, 12- 3.42 , 13- 3.38, 14- 3.38, 15- 9.2 dropping 8.0, 17- 320mv , 19 - 5.3 , 20- 5.5, 27-  148mv
<DIODE>D7010</DIODE> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> are good tested/changed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message: it turns on with charged battery when <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> placed but no green/orange and charging.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message: Did you post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages without the chip soldered on the board???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a [SOLVED]
threads.message: CASE CLOSED, <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> was faulty, changed and everything good.
